data.event: The county was named in honor of Richard Montgomery, an American Revolutionary War general killed in 1775 at the Battle of Quebec.
It was created in 1772 as Tryon County and in 1784 was renamed Montgomery County.
It was created in 1772 as Tryon County and in 1784 was renamed Montgomery County.
This change was to honor the general, Richard Montgomery, who had captured several places in Canada and died in 1775 attempting to capture the city of Quebec during the Revolutionary War.
In 1789, Ontario County was split off from Montgomery.
